Mechanisms Underlying Weight Changes

Several actors contribute to the weight changes observed in individuals with

bipolar disorder:

   • Hormonal fuctuations: The hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis

    is activated during manic episodes, leading to increased cortisol levels.

    Elevated cortisol promotes at storage and redistribution (3).

   • Medication side eects: Antipsychotics and mood stabilizers commonly

    used in BD treatment can cause weight gain due to their metabolic

    eects (4).
